text: <@UDY957C6M> has left the channel

Idea: The form module when building custom modules leaves out fields like follow up, workflow etc... that is included in the standard form module. Could a toggle be added for all settings to be included or just in general have all of the options a regular form module comes with be added to the form module in custom modules.

Hey Reg, I think there might be some misunderstanding here between the form field and the default form module. The from module is a combination of multiple fields that handle all those extra features. If you want to see the fields and code behind a form module, you can open it up in the design manager by searching for `Form`. The form field is just concerned with selecting the most basic things for a form.

I agree with Reg, it’s a pain having to set up all the fields when i want to set up a form in a module, if i’ve thought about it early enough i’ll clone the default module if my module has a form in it, but if i haven’t there’s alot of set up just to get a form to display.
And you can’t just hit copy snippet to get your field.
This is on our roadmap. More to come shortly on this.
Yep just checked there are 15

Idea: In the email composer, can there be a way to add the total size of the email? For example, when building the email, it would keep a running total of the total size of the email that will be sent. This would be helpful because email clients like gmail will clip a message after 102 kb so it would be helpful to know if all of your email will be shown or not.
(link for some info on this: <https://www.emailonacid.com/blog/article/email-development/how_does_email_file_size_affect_deliverability/>)

Maybe add this to the top bar near the "save" button
I like where your head's at, <@U2H3TT8F2>
Great minds:
Not clear yet when (/if) it'd be available, but the team definitely dig the idea.

cause I have a client that it would be perfect for

the create new tag modal in blog dashboard doesn’t auto focus the field, would be nice if that happened. also on many of these modal forms hitting enter does not submit the form, would be nice if it did. would make it feel less tedious, and would make accessibility people happy

*Idea*: add “dependencies” list to the navigation settings so you can see where each menu gets referenced.

Will help prevent people from accidentally screwing up important menus, or stuff like that
*Bug:* on the new navigation settings page, you can’t highlight text in the input fields because it drags the whole menu item. please make it so it only drags if you click the outer element
